intro: Ervatamia graciliflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered ervatamia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows as a low, shrub-like perennial with narrow, gray-green leaves. Its flowers, which appear in late summer, are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Ervatamia graciliflora is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, showcasing resilience through its deep root system and water-conserving features.
